176.title: Punjab budget will be in line with people’s expectations: Minister
176.article_body: Punjab Finance Minister Harpal Singh Cheema said that the state will present a comprehensive budget, which will be in line with people's expectations. Cheema added that Punjab CM Bhagwant  Mann had promised that the budget would be formulated as per people's wishes and expectations. He also criticised the previous governments for not formulating a concrete policy for Punjab's development.

177.title: NCP has never disturbed MVA: Jayant Patil to Nana Patole
177.article_body: Maharashtra NCP chief Jayant Patil said that NCP has never tried to disturb the ruling coalition Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government comprising of Shiv Sena, NCP and Congress. Patil's statement came after Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole said that NCP stabbed Congress in the back. Patole was referring to NCP joining hands with BJP during Gondia Zilla Parishad elections.

178.title: Teak wood worth ₹80 lakh seized in Madhya Pradesh's Guna
178.article_body: The forest department confiscated over 4,000 illegally cut teak wood logs worth ₹80 lakh and a wood cutter machine after they conducted a raid in Binaganj village of Madhya Pradesh's Guna district, officials said. The operation was a joint raid by Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan forest departments. Teak wood was illegally cut and smuggled to Rajasthan from here, officials added.

179.title: Can't recognise Depp from clips of trial: Ex-fiancee Jennifer Grey
179.article_body: Johnny Depp's ex-fiancee Jennifer Grey, speaking about the actor's defamation trial against Amber Heard, has said, "I haven't watched any of it...But from clips...I've come across, I don't recognise the person." "It's nothing to do with anything that I've ever experienced, and it makes me sad," she added. Jennifer and Depp were engaged in the late 1980s.

180.title: Days after BJYM worker's death, another BJP worker found dead in WB
180.article_body: Days after BJYM activist Arjun Chaurasia was found hanging in an abandoned building in Kolkata, another BJP activist, identified as Krishna Patra, was found dead on Wednesday in East Midnapore district. West Bengal BJP President Sukanta Majumdar blamed TMC for his death. He claimed that Patra was "abducted from his house and killed by TMC miscreants".

181.title: 60-year-old man dies while burying woman he strangled in US
181.article_body: An American man died of a "cardiac event" in his backyard in South Carolina while burying a 65-year-old woman he strangled, local authorities said. Officials responded to reports of an unresponsive man in the town of Trenton and found 60-year-old Joseph McKinnon dead. "McKinnon had no signs of trauma and natural causes were suspected," said officials.

182.title: Free pilgrimage, power for citizens; BJP govt failed in Guj: Delhi CM
182.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday promised free pilgrimage for senior citizens to various religious places if the AAP was voted to power in Gujarat. He also promised free electricity, better schools and hospitals, adding that the BJP government failed on multiple fronts in the state. "The AAP is a party of educated, honest and patriotic people," he said.

183.title: Man's mutilated body found on railway tracks in Punjab's Ludhiana
183.article_body: Government Railway Police (GRP) officials said that a mutilated body of a man was recovered from the railway tracks in Punjab's Ludhiana. Officials added that the deceased is yet to be identified, and the body was found on the track where goods trains ply. "It is an accident and not suicide," a GRP officer investigating the case said.

184.title: Govt eases environmental rules for coal mines to tackle fuel crisis
184.article_body: The Centre has eased environmental approvals for expansion of coal mines to boost output amid the ongoing fuel crisis across the country. A government note said the move will enable raising coal production by a further 10% without requiring new impact assessments. Rules on consulting local residents about the expansions have also been loosened, the note added.

185.title: Will appoint a new PM and cabinet this week, says Sri Lanka President
185.article_body: Amid crisis in Sri Lanka, President Gotabaya Rajapaksa addressed the nation and said he was working with all party leaders to establish a new government in the country. He said a new Prime Minister will be appointed within a week, according to local media. "I'm going to appoint the PM and...cabinet that has the trust of the people," he stated.

186.title: Birds fall from sky in Gujarat amid heatwave; pics show their rescue
186.article_body: Dozens of exhausted and dehydrated birds are dropping everyday in Gujarat amid heatwave, veterinary doctors and rescuers have said. "This year has been one of the worst in the recent times. We've seen a 10% increase in the number of birds that need rescuing," non-profit Jivdaya Charitable Trust's official said. Pictures showing veterinary doctors treating the birds have also surfaced.

187.title: Pakistan PM Shehbaz meets brother Nawaz Sharif in London, video surfaces
187.article_body: Newly-elected Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif on Wednesday met his brother and Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz supremo Nawaz Sharif in London, the party tweeted and shared a video. Nawaz Sharif's daughter Maryam Nawaz Sharif also shared a picture of the Sharif brothers and captioned it "Mashallah". Nawaz Sharif, who was convicted in two corruption cases, has been living in London since 2019.

188.title: Many in B'wood don't praise me due to their own insecurities: Kangana
188.article_body: Kangana Ranaut, speaking about Bollywood, has said, "These people don't want to praise me. Sometimes, I feel there is no lobby but people have a lot of their own insecurities." However, she added that she met Kiara Advani and she praised her. Kangana also said that everyone at a Bollywood party was talking about her 'Dhaakad' trailer.

189.title: Haryana announces Anti-Terror Squad after blast in Punjab's Mohali
189.article_body: The Haryana government on Wednesday said it will constitute an Anti-Terror Squad after a blast at the Punjab Police Intelligence headquarters in Mohali on Monday. Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij has asked senior officials to ensure all important buildings in the state are covered by CCTV cameras. He added that there is a need to increase security in the state.

190.title: Discussed caste census: Tejashwi on meeting with Bihar CM Nitish
190.article_body: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Tejashwi Yadav met Bihar CM Nitish Kumar at a closed-door meeting on Wednesday evening and said that the two discussed caste census and other issues. "I also raised the issue of unemployment and requested him to fill the vacant posts. He asked me to keep faith in him," Tejashwi said.

191.title: Book on PM Modi to become 'Gita' for people in politics: Amit Shah
191.article_body: During the launch of the book 'Modi@20: Dreams Meet Delivery', Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that it will "become equivalent to the Gita" for those who believe in social work and politics. He said PM Modi's three decades of early struggle gave him the strength to understand crucial problems and make policies for everyone.

192.title: Why did Depp's lawyer celebrate as Amber mentioned Depp allegedly pushing Moss?
192.article_body: During her testimony in Johnny Depp's defamation trial against her, Amber Heard mentioned Kate Moss being allegedly pushed down the stairs by Depp, who dated Moss. Following this, Depp's lawyer fist-pumped. Experts explained this could give Depp's team chance to dispel the supposed rumour, said New York Post. It could open door for Depp's attorneys to call Moss as witness.

193.title: Ravindra Jadeja ruled out of remaining IPL 2022 matches
193.article_body: Chennai Super Kings (CSK) all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja has been ruled out of the remaining matches of IPL 2022 owing to a bruised rib. He had sustained the injury during CSK's match against Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) on May 4. Jadeja scored 116 runs and took five wickets in 10 IPL 2022 matches.

194.title: Iran's artillery fire hits 'terrorist bases' in Iraq's Erbil: Report
194.article_body: Iran's Revolutionary Guards' artillery fire hit "terrorist bases" in Iraq's Erbil on Wednesday, according to a report. However, no casualties were reported in the shelling, which took place in a village in the Sidekan area near the Iranian border, the report added. Meanwhile, a news agency has reported that IRGC had previously targeted Iranian Kurdish militants based in northern Iraq.

195.title: Apple's top engineer quits due to company's return to office policy: Report
195.article_body: Ian Goodfellow, Apple's Director of Machine Learning, is reportedly leaving the company over its return to office policy. According to The Verge reporter Zoë Schiffer, Goodfellow told the company's staff, "I believe strongly that more flexibility would have been the best policy for my team." Starting May 23, Apple reportedly requires employees in the office three days a week.

196.title: My condom ad was called the beginning of sexual revolution in India: Pooja
196.article_body: Actress Pooja Bedi has said that British tabloids had called her controversial condom advertisement from the 1990s the beginning of the sexual revolution in India. "It won many awards and made advertising history. It was great to have been a trailblazer because of it," she stated. The advertisement, directed by Alyque Padamsee, was banned by Doordarshan.

197.title: FHRAI again urges SEBI to cancel OYO's IPO citing its losses
197.article_body: The Federation of Hotel and Restaurant Associations of India (FHRAI) has once again urged SEBI to call off OYO's IPO citing massive losses suffered by the travel-tech firm in recent years. FHRAI said OYO suffered ₹3,943.84 crore in FY21. Since its inception in 2013, OYO's total turnover has fallen 69% from ₹13,413 crore in 2020 to ₹4,157 crore in 2021.

198.title: Special teams to check violation of loudspeaker rules: K'taka Minister
198.article_body: Karnataka Minister Anand Singh said that special teams will conduct surprise visits to check violations of loudspeaker rules. "Appropriate action will be taken against all those found violating decibel standards while using loudspeakers," he added. Karnataka government said that a loudspeaker shall not be used except after obtaining written permission from the designated authorities.

199.title: Parents confine 11-yr-old son with 22 stray dogs in Pune flat; 4 dead dogs found
199.article_body: An FIR has been lodged against the parents of an 11-year-old boy for allegedly keeping him confined in an apartment with 22 stray dogs in Pune. Dnyan Devi Childline's Anuradha Sahasrabuddhe said, "We also found four dog carcasses there. Even animal excreta wasn't removed." She alleged he was kept with dogs for two years and it impacted his behavioural development.

200.title: Was trolled for accent, now videos are made on my one-liners: Shehnaaz
200.article_body: Actress and former 'Big Boss' contestant Shehnaaz Gill has said that she was trolled for her accent but added that she has made it her strength. "Aaj mere one-liners pe log video banate hai (Now people make videos on my one-liners)," she added. Shehnaaz further stated, "That's why I feel nobody should be made fun of."

201.title: Ravichandran Ashwin smashes his first-ever fifty in IPL
201.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin on Wednesday smashed his first-ever fifty in IPL. Playing his 71st innings in IPL, the 35-year-old scored 50 runs off 38 deliveries while batting at number three against Delhi Capitals (DC). Ashwin smashed four fours and two sixes during his knock. Ashwin has now scored 589 runs in his IPL career.

202.title: Drug capsules found inside woman's body at Coimbatore Airport
202.article_body: Coimbatore Air Intelligence Unit officials said that 81 capsules of drugs were recovered from the body of a woman passenger, who had arrived at Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore Airport from Sharjah. "The woman had swallowed the capsules, which upon testing were found to be Methamphetamine drugs," Coimbatore Air Intelligence Unit officials added.

203.title: Guj's public debt at ₹3,00,000 cr, lowest among big states: Govt
203.article_body: At over ₹3,00,000 crore, Gujarat's public debt is the lowest among states with big populations in the country, the state government said on Wednesday. "Gujarat's debt is only 16% of its GDP against 22 to 24% in other states," said Education Minister Jitu Vaghani. He added that road projects worth ₹12,200 crore will be completed by October this year.

204.title: Morgan Stanley cuts India's GDP growth forecasts by 30 bps
204.article_body: Morgan Stanley has lowered its forecasts for India's GDP growth to 7.6% for FY23 and 6.7% for FY24, 30 basis points lower than the previous estimates. Both inflation and the country's current account deficit will likely get worse, it said. The report cited a global slowdown, surging oil prices and weak domestic demand as some of the reasons.

205.title: MHA staffers among 14 arrested by CBI in corruption probe over FCRA licence
205.article_body: CBI on Wednesday arrested 14 people, including Home Ministry staffers, in its corruption probe in the Foreign Contribution Regulation Act (FCRA) division of the Ministry. The arrests were made for committing violations of FCRA provisions and facilitating illegal clearances in lieu of bribes. CBI had raided 40 locations across India in this connection on Tuesday.

206.title: Delhivery IPO subscribed 21% on Day 1, retail portion booked 30%
206.article_body: Logistics unicorn Delhivery's IPO got subscribed 21% on the first day of subscription on Wednesday. The IPO received bids for 1.32 crore shares against 6.25 crore shares on offer, according to data available with the NSE. While the retail investors bid for 30% of the shares reserved for them, employees booked 6% and non-institutional buyers booked 1% of their portions.

207.title: Delhi's daily COVID-19 cases fall to 970, positivity rate dips to 3.34%
207.article_body: Delhi on Wednesday reported 970 new cases of COVID-19 as compared to 1,118 cases recorded on Tuesday. The city also saw one death due to COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, while the positivity rate dropped to 3.34% from Tuesday's 4.38%. The number of active COVID-19 cases stood at 5,202, while it was 5,471 the previous day.

208.title: Health, digital adoption among '5 megatrends' for the future: Tata Sons Chairman
208.article_body: Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran has listed 'Digital adoption', 'Supply chain rebalance', 'Sustainability', 'Health' and 'Global talent pool' as the "five megatrends" for the future. He said these will have a "big impact" on economies, countries and businesses globally.  "All businesses will have to become AI and data businesses...No industry can escape this trend," he said on digital adoption.

209.title: BJP govt in UP doesn't want Azam Khan to come out of jail: Akhilesh
209.article_body: Samajwadi Party (SP) chief Akhilesh Yadav on Wednesday said that the BJP government in UP doesn't want Azam Khan to come out of jail. "Under pressure from the government, some officers imposed wrong cases on him. We are hopeful that he will be released soon," he added. There are a total of 88 cases registered against Khan.

210.title: Apni beti ko sambhal: Farah to Chunky Panday on 'overacting' comment
210.article_body: Farah Khan shared a video, featuring Ananya Panday, on Instagram in which she tells Ananya that she's won a National Award for 'Khaali Peeli'. Later, Farah used Ananya's father Chunky Panday's line from 'Housefull', "I'm joking." Chunky commented, "Farah you should get the award for overacting in this video." To this, she replied, "Apni beti ko sambhal (Handle your daughter)."

211.title: SL's economy will collapse if no new govt in 2 days: Central Bank chief
211.article_body: Sri Lanka's Central Bank Governor Nandalal Weerasinghe on Wednesday said, "If there is no government in the next two days, the economy will completely collapse and no one will be able to save it." "I'll resign if there is no immediate action to form a government," he added. Notably, Sri Lankan PM Mahinda Rajapaksa had resigned amid the economic crisis.

212.title: UP DGP Mukul Goel removed for disobeying orders, lacking interest in work: Reports
212.article_body: Uttar Pradesh DGP Mukul Goel has been removed from his post and transferred to Civil Security, according to reports. He was transferred after it was found that he was disregarding orders and was not taking interest in departmental work, the reports added. The name of new DGP of the state is yet to be announced.

213.title: Why should we go to another industry: Mahesh Babu on 'B'wood can't afford me' remark
213.article_body: Telugu actor Mahesh Babu, who courted controversy for saying 'Bollywood can't afford me', stated, "I've always wanted to do Telugu films." "I've always wished for Telugu movies to do well across the country. I strongly feel, why should we go to another industry by leaving ours behind?" he added. Mahesh further clarified that he respects all languages.

214.title: Punjab govt revises security of 8 leaders including Harsimrat Badal
214.article_body: The Punjab government has revised the security cover of eight political leaders, including former CM Rajinder Kaur Bhattal, former Deputy CM OP Soni, SAD MP Harsimrat Kaur Badal and Congress leader Sunil Jakhar. In total, 127 police personnel and nine vehicles have been withdrawn from the eight leaders. The government cited no specific threat to the leaders.

215.title: 62 kg heroin worth ₹434cr seized from trolley bags at Delhi airport
215.article_body: Directorate of Revenue Intelligence has seized 62 kg of heroin worth ₹434 crore at the Indira Gandhi International Airport air cargo complex in Delhi. This is one of the biggest seizures of heroin till date through courier or cargo or air passenger modes in India, the Finance Ministry said. It was concealed inside hollow metal tubes of 126 trolley bags.

216.title: Akshay, Nawazuddin, Madhavan to walk on 2022 Cannes red carpet: Report
216.article_body: Actors Akshay Kumar, Nawazuddin Siddiqui and R Madhavan are reportedly among the Indian celebrities who will walk on the red carpet at the 2022 Cannes Film Festival. Music composer AR Rahman and actress Pooja Hegde will also reportedly feature on the red carpet. The Indian delegation at the Cannes will be led by Information and Broadcasting Minister Anurag Thakur.

217.title: Santoor maestro Pandit Shivkumar Sharma cremated with full state honours
217.article_body: Santoor maestro Pandit Shivkumar Sharma was cremated with full state honours in Mumbai on Wednesday. Shivkumar passed away, aged 84, on Tuesday due to cardiac arrest. His funeral took place at Vile Parle's Pawan Hans Crematorium. Amitabh Bachchan and Jaya Bachchan paid their tribute to Pandit Shivkumar at the funeral. Tabla maestro Zakir Hussain also attended the funeral.

218.title: Respect human rights, listen to hopes of people: Pope to SL leaders
218.article_body: Pope Francis on Wednesday urged the Sri Lankan authorities to respect human rights after violent clashes erupted in the country over the government's handling of the economic crisis. "I appeal to...those who've responsibility to listen to...hopes of the people, guaranteeing full respect for human rights and civil liberties," Francis said. At least eight people have been killed in the clashes.

219.title: Only Congress can defeat BJP at the national level: Sachin Pilot
219.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot said that if there is any party that can defeat BJP and NDA at the national level, it is the Congress party. Pilot's comments came before Congress' "Nav Chintan Shivir" in Udaipur, which will be attended by over 400 party leaders, where they will hold discussions on how to challenge the ruling NDA.

220.title: Grandchild in a year or pay ₹5 cr: Parents who sued son, daughter-in-law in U'khand
220.article_body: A couple from Uttarakhand has moved court against their son and daughter-in-law demanding either a grandchild within a year or ₹2.5-crore compensation each from the son and daughter-in-law. "They were wedded in 2016 in hopes of having grandchildren," petitioner SR Prasad said. "I gave my son all my money...got him trained in America...I don't have any money now," Prasad added.

221.title: Govt issues guidelines for schools amid heat wave, asks schools to modify timings
221.article_body: Government issued guidelines regarding precautions to be observed by schools to combat heat wave. "Number of school hours per day may be reduced and school assembly should be conducted in covered area," it said. "Students may be allowed to wear loose and light coloured cotton material dress. Schools may relax norms regarding uniform such as neck ties," government added.

222.title: Putin is preparing for a long war in Ukraine, warns US intelligence
222.article_body: US National Intelligence's Director Avril Haines has said that Russian President Vladimir Putin is preparing for a long war in Ukraine. Putin was "probably" counting on US and EU support for Ukraine to weaken as inflation, food shortages and energy prices got worse, Haines said. Putin will "likely" impose martial law in Russia to support the Ukraine war, she added.

223.title: 13-foot-long king cobra caught in Andhra Pradesh; pic goes viral
223.article_body: A snake catcher named Venkatesh rescued a 13-foot-long king cobra from a palm oil plantation in Andhra Pradesh's Ghat Road recently, a picture of which has gone viral online. A farmer had reportedly informed Venkatesh, who reached the spot and put the snake into a gunny bag and carried the reptile away after catching it.

224.title: DC to bowl first against RR, make 2 changes to their playing XI
224.article_body: DC captain Rishabh Pant won the toss and elected to bowl first against RR in their IPL 2022 clash on Wednesday. DC have made two changes to their playing XI, with Lalit Yadav and Chetan Sakariya replacing Ripal Patel and Khaleel Ahmed, respectively. Meanwhile, Rassie van der dussen has replaced Shimron Hetmyer in RR's playing XI.

225.title: Iran detains 2 Europeans for inciting 'chaos' in the country: Report
225.article_body: Iran's Intelligence Ministry has arrested two Europeans and claimed that they're "experienced agents" hired by a European country's intelligence apparatus, a report stated. The ministry alleged that the duo had travelled to Iran seeking to turn regular protests into "chaos, social disorder and instability". The arrests come during a visit by EU envoy Enrique Mora over Iran's stalled nuclear talks.

226.title: Taj Mahal land originally belonged to my family: BJP MP & Jaipur Royal Family member
226.article_body: BJP MP and Jaipur Royal Family member Diya Kumari has claimed that the land on which the Taj Mahal was built originally belonged to her family, adding, "We had a palace on that land." She added she has documents to prove the claim. Earlier, a petition sought ASI to check for Hindu idols in 22 locked doors of the monument.

227.title: Masjidein lene do, inko khoon kharaba mat karne do: Mehbooba Mufti
227.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti on Wednesday said, "Masjidein lete hain toh lene do, magar inko khoon kharaba karne ka mauqa mat do." "We can pray anywhere, even by the roadside. We do not need a building to pray, we (Muslims) can bow down before God at any place," she said.

228.title: Dharmendra shares still with Shabana Azmi from 'Rocky Aur Rani...'
228.article_body: Veteran actor Dharmendra has shared a still with actress Shabana Azmi on Twitter from their upcoming film 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani'. Dharmendra wrote, "Ishq hai mujhe camera se...aur camera ko...Shaid mujh se (I am in love with the camera and I think the camera loves me)." The film also stars Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt.

229.title: Chinese burn 3 am oil, Americans avoid going to work at all: Musk
229.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk praised Chinese workers in a recent interview. He said, "[Chinese] won't just be burning the midnight oil...they'll be burning the 3 am oil...whereas, in America, people are trying to avoid going to work at all." Musk added that most of Tesla's competition would come from China while adding, "There are...supertalented hardworking people in China."

230.title: TDP chief Naidu writes to Amit Shah over ex-AP minister Narayana's arrest
230.article_body: After former Andhra Pradesh Minister P Narayana was arrested on Tuesday, TDP chief N Chandrababu Naidu wrote to Union Home Minister Amit Shah and claimed that the YSRCP-led state government made the arrest based on false evidence. Notably, Narayana was arrested in connection with a Class 10 exam paper leak case. However, a court granted bail to Narayana on Wednesday.

231.title: US inflation rises 8.3% in April, slight drop from March's 40-yr-high
231.article_body: Retail inflation in the US rose 8.3% in April from 12 months earlier, the country's Labor Department said on Wednesday. This is however below the 8.5% y-o-y rise in March, which was the highest rate in 40 years since 1981. On a month-to-month basis, prices rose 0.3% from March to April, the smallest increase in eight months.

232.title: Investors lose over ₹13 lakh crore in a four-day decline in stocks
232.article_body: A four-day decline in stocks has wiped out over ₹13.32 lakh crore from the market capitalisation of BSE-listed firms. The BSE Sensex plummeted 276 points to close at 54,088 in its fourth-straight session of decline on Wednesday. Larsen & Toubro, Bajaj Finserv, Bajaj Finance, PowerGrid, NTPC, Infosys and Maruti were among the top losers in the Sensex pack on Wednesday.

233.title: Class 12 student killed, woman injured during street brawl in Delhi
233.article_body: A class 12 student was killed while a woman was injured after a youth attacked them with a knife during a street brawl at a slum cluster in Delhi's Sarai Rohilla, police said on Wednesday. Arzu's (accused) mother and the survivor were quarrelling before the accused intervened and stabbed her and later stabbed the class 12 student to death.

234.title: Raj MLA Girraj Singh surrenders before police in engineers' assault case
234.article_body: Congress MLA Girraj Singh Malinga, who is accused of assaulting two power department engineers in the Dholpur district, surrendered before the police in Jaipur on Wednesday. He said the allegations of assault were baseless. Malinga said he met Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot in the morning and was asked to surrender before the police.

235.title: After I became a mom, designers said, 'Nothing's fitting you': Neha
235.article_body: Actress Neha Dhupia recalled her postpartum depression after giving birth to her first child in 2018. "The day you give birth it's...an amazing feeling...And still trying to go to work...then...at fittings people saying 'oh but nothing's really fitting you...maybe we should work...sometime later'," she said. "It's a downward spiral but I've been through it and I've learned," she added.

236.title: Dalits unsafe in BJP-ruled states: NCP leader Mahesh Tapase
236.article_body: NCP leader Mahesh Tapase said that Dalits are "not safe" in BJP-ruled states. He said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi should personally give an assurance of protecting members of the community in the country. Tapase's comment comes after the former head of Pawti Khurd village in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar announced a ban on the entry of Dalits into his fields.

237.title: IAS officer Pooja Singhal accused in ₹18 cr fraud case in Jharkhand arrested by ED
237.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has arrested IAS officer and Jharkhand Mining Secretary Pooja Singhal, who is being investigated in a money laundering case linked to alleged embezzlement of ₹18-crore MGNREGA funds. Earlier, a viral video showed over ₹17 crore in cash being recovered during a raid at the house of a CA linked to Singhal.

238.title: No one's talking about the film, we're all stuck at ₹1000 cr: Manoj
238.article_body: Actor Manoj Bajpayee has said, "No one is talking about the film." He added, "No one wants to discuss the film, its performances, the other departments who have contributed in making that film." He stated everyone is stuck at ₹1000 crore. "This fight has been going on for years. I think this mess is not going to end," Manoj said.

239.title: NCP workers protest against inflation in Pune, chant Hanuman Aarti
239.article_body: The Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) led by MP Supriya Sule on Wednesday staged a protest in Pune against rising prices of gas and fuel. "Modiji, we are not angry with you, we are annoyed. How can you show such insensitivity? How can your government be so insensitive?" Sule said. Party activists were also seen performing Hanuman Aarti at the site.

240.title: Heat wave, rainfall warnings issued for several states over 5 days; IMD releases list
240.article_body: Heat wave conditions are very likely over Rajasthan on May 11, 12, 14 and 15 and in Madhya Pradesh on May 11, 13 and 15. They are also likely over parts of Maharashtra on May 11; Uttar Pradesh on May 14 and 15 and Haryana-Delhi and Punjab during May 12-15. Rainfall is likely over Northeast India during next 5 days.

241.title: Modi govt takes decisions that are for the good of the people: Shah
241.article_body: During the launch of the book 'Modi@20: Dreams Meet Delivery', Union Home Minister Amit Shah said, "[PM Narendra Modi] government doesn't take decisions that will please people. It takes decisions that are for the good of the people." PM Modi should be seen from a holistic view and not from an isolated view to understand his political life, Shah added.

242.title: Misleading: Air India on woman's panic attack video after boarding denied at airport
242.article_body: Air India said, "It's conveying a misleading image of Air India being apathetic towards a passenger," after a video showed that a woman allegedly suffered a panic attack at Delhi airport. In the video shared on Instagram, it was alleged the woman and her relatives were denied boarding by Air India staff due to a delay of a few minutes.

243.title: No need to panic: Maha Health Minister on rising COVID-19 cases
243.article_body: Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope has said that though there is a rise in COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra, there is no need to panic. He said that states like Punjab, Uttar Pradesh and Delhi are witnessing a similar spike, but most of the people infected have only experienced mild symptoms. "In Maharashtra, cases are rising but not rapidly," Tope added.

244.title: Punjab HC gave resounding slap to Kejriwal for misusing police: Bagga
244.article_body: Delhi BJP leader Tajinder Singh Bagga, who was arrested last week, on Wednesday said that the Punjab High Court has given a "resounding slap" to Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal. "The country used to salute the Punjab Police which had defeated Khalistan," he said. The police is now given the job of arresting people who tweet against Kejriwal, he added.

245.title: Kashmir has startup potential in agri, dairy sectors: Jitendra Singh
245.article_body: Union Science and Technology Minister Jitendra Singh said Kashmir has huge, largely unexplored startup potential in the agriculture and dairy sectors. The youth should look beyond government jobs as a source of livelihood, Singh added. He also assured help to youth from the central government in setting up employment generating units for themselves and others.

246.title: Cummins is a world-class bowler, KKR still benched him: Shastri
246.article_body: Discussing all-rounder Pat Cummins, ex-India coach Ravi Shastri said, "Thankfully KKR...played Cummins [in their win against MI by 52 runs]. [I] wonder what he was doing warming the bench." "He is Australia's Test captain, a world-class bowler and they still benched him," added Shastri. Cummins has taken seven wickets in IPL 2022 so far at an economy rate of 10.68.

247.title: Apple testing folding panel for iPhone and iPad: Report
247.article_body: Apple is developing a new folding OLED screen that would eventually be used in a folding iPhone or iPad, South Korea's TheElec reported. Apple is reportedly developing a polarizer-less OLED screen, the same technology which is used by Samsung in its Galaxy Z Fold3 and its Eco2OLED display. Currently, polarizer is being used in some conventional folding displays.

248.title: File 1,000 FIRs, but I'll keep asking questions: Bagga to Kejriwal
248.article_body: Criticising Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and Punjab Police over his arrest, BJP leader Tajinder Bagga said that even if a thousand FIRs are filed against him, he will continue asking questions. Bagga, who was arrested by the Punjab Police last week, claimed that he was arrested for "asking questions". Bagga said he was arrested for reminding Kejriwal of his promises.

249.title: Will take her to ISRO: Smriti Irani on UP girl aspiring to be scientist
249.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani during her visit to Uttar Pradesh's Amethi promised a girl student a visit to Indian Space Research Organisation next month. The polytechnic student had told Irani that she wanted to be a scientist and work at the national space agency. "It's a matter of pride for Amethi that [she] wants to become a scientist," Irani said.

250.title: More pressure on RR than DC, DC are like a wounded tiger: Ajay Jadeja
250.article_body: Ex-India batter Ajay Jadeja said there is more pressure on RR than DC in their upcoming match, despite being currently placed third on the IPL 2022 points table. "DC have been so up and down that it's...difficult...to predict what RR will be up against. DC are like a wounded tiger," added Ajay. "They have everything to lose," stated Ajay.

251.title: Telling truth is not treason: Rahul as SC puts sedition law on hold
251.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday welcomed the Supreme Court's order to put the sedition law on hold. Rahul said, "Telling the truth is patriotism, not treason. Listening to the truth is one's duty...Crushing the truth is arrogance." Meanwhile, Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala termed the apex court's decision as "historic" and said, "Speaking truth to power can't be sedition."

252.title: 24-year-old man stabbed to death by neighbour in Mumbai
252.article_body: A 24-year-old man, Shubham Dangat, was stabbed to death by his neighbour in Mumbai's Kurla over past enmity. Police said that the accused, Tanaji Kawar, had attacked Dangat's mother with a wooden log in 2017 and was arrested. During a heated argument with Dangat, Kawar, who was out on bail, stabbed him on his head, chest and back, police added.

253.title: 22-yr-old dials 100 citing danger to life at 2:30am, asks police to get beer in T'gana
253.article_body: A 22-year-old man has been booked in Telangana's Doulatabad for allegedly misusing the Dial100 emergency service. Police said the man, who was at a wedding, called on the number and claimed his life was in danger, following which police arrived at the spot. He then told them that he wanted two beer bottles and that the police should get it.

254.title: Jennifer Aniston to be the final guest of 'The Ellen DeGeneres Show'
254.article_body: Actress Jennifer Aniston will be the final guest in the farewell episode of 'The Ellen DeGeneres Show'. The actress was also Ellen's first-ever guest on the show when it began in 2003. The talk show will be ending after 19 seasons. Along with Jennifer, singers Pink and Billie Eilish will also feature in the episode.

255.title: Hyderabad airport sets up special help desk for Gulf-bound workers
255.article_body: The Hyderabad international airport has set up a special help desk that will run round-the-clock for migrant workers travelling to middle eastern countries. It is located at the international departure terminal. An official said that the presence of a dedicated migrant help desk will help in scrutinising the documents of the travellers and guide them in emigration clearance.

256.title: I mute the TV, I don't pay attention to what people are saying: Virat Kohli on critics
256.article_body: Talking about how he cuts out the outside noise amid his bad form in IPL 2022, Virat Kohli said, "You either mute the TV or don't pay attention to what people are saying. I do both of these things." Kohli has scored 216 runs in IPL 2022 so far at an average of 19.64 and a strike rate of 111.34.

257.title: Rescued after kidnap, woman jumps off 2nd floor in UP police station campus
257.article_body: A 19-year-old woman, who was rescued from Etah a week after she was kidnapped, jumped off the second floor of the Mahila Barrack in the Vijay Garh police station campus in Aligarh on Tuesday. Reports said that the woman was housed at the barracks after being rescued and has sustained serious injuries on various parts of body, including her head.

258.title: Skeletons at Punjab well found belonging to 282 Indian soldiers martyred in 1857 revolt
258.article_body: The skeletons that were dug up in Punjab in 2014 have been found to belong to 282 Indian soldiers who were martyred during India's first freedom struggle against the British in 1857, said Dr JS Sehrawat, Assistant Professor, Department of Anthropology, Panjab University. "These were excavated from a well found underneath a religious structure in Ajnala near Amritsar," he said.

259.title: Woman kills teenage stepsons in UP, police suspect property dispute
259.article_body: UP police on Wednesday arrested a woman for allegedly killing her two stepsons, aged 18 and 15. According to police, Srinavas has two wives - Kusum and Mansa Devi. Around 5 am in morning, Kusum along with her son and daughter-in-law killed Devi's children when she was not at home, police added, suspecting property dispute as reason behind the crime.

260.title: China calls WHO chief 'irresponsible' for criticising its zero-COVID policy
260.article_body: China on Wednesday defended sticking to its strict "zero-COVID-19" approach, calling critical remarks from WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus "irresponsible". Ghebreyesus had said that China's "zero-COVID-19" policy is not "sustainable" considering the behaviour of the virus. Tedros must view China's policy "objectively" and "get more knowledge about the facts", China said.

261.title: Even PM Modi’s detractors agree he is a phenomenon: VP Naidu
261.article_body: While addressing a gathering after releasing the book 'Modi@ 20: Dreams Meet Delivery', VP M Venkaiah Naidu said that even PM Modi's detractors believe he is a phenomenon. He added that while Mahatma Gandhi took the freedom struggle out of the hands of the elite to turn it into a mass movement, PM had converted developmental initiatives into mass movements.

262.title: Sri Lanka CID summons ex-PM’s security head over Monday violence
262.article_body: The Crime Investigation Department (CID) of Sri Lanka has reportedly summoned the security head of former PM Mahinda Rajapaksa and other officials in connection with the violence that occurred on Monday. At least eight people have been killed and over 200 injured in the clashes amid protests over the ongoing economic crisis. Several vehicles and properties were reportedly burned down.

263.title: 19% Indian households do not use any toilet facility: NFHS report
263.article_body: According to 2019-21 National Family Health Survey (NFHS), 19% of Indian households don't use any toilet facility and defecate in open as compared to 39% in 2015-16. Bihar has the lowest access to toilets at 62%, followed by Jharkhand (70%) and Odisha (71%). Moreover, 11% of urban households use a shared facility as compared to seven percent of rural households.

264.title: UK mulls law to make espionage punishable by life imprisonment
264.article_body: The UK is planning to introduce a law that seeks to make espionage punishable by life imprisonment, according to a report. Currently, the maximum penalty for the offence is imprisonment up to 14 years. "The Bill will, for the first time, make it an offence to be a covert foreign spy on our soil," said UK Home Secretary Priti Patel.

265.title: If B'wood can't afford Mahesh Babu's price, then very good; to each his own: Mukesh Bhatt
265.article_body: Mukesh Bhatt, speaking to India Today, reacted to Mahesh Babu's 'Bollywood can't afford me' remark. "If Bollywood can't afford his price, then very good...I respect where he comes from. He has talent and he has an 'X' value for the talent," Mukesh added. "Bollywood cannot work to his expectations, there's nothing wrong with it...To each his own," he stated.

266.title: Tiger Global marks its first seed investment in India with Shopflo
266.article_body: E-commerce enablement startup Shopflo has raised $2.6 million in seed funding from Tiger Global and TQ Ventures, making it Tiger Global's first seed investment in India. Others who participated in the funding include Better Capital as well as several angel investors. Shopflo helps D2C brands improve their checkout experience at their own websites and improve conversion rates.

267.title: Please euthanize me: Ex-bus driver writes to PM after being fired by BMTC
267.article_body: An ex-bus driver of Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation had written a letter to PM Narendra Modi and President Ram Nath Kovind, requesting euthanasia for him. He's said to have been fired from BMTC after officials suspected him to have participated in a transport strike. "[Getting] fired means my [children] have fallen out on...street...[I've] no choice, please euthanize me," he wrote.

268.title: Al Jazeera journalist likely killed by Palestinian gunfire: Israel PM
268.article_body: Israeli PM Naftali Bennett said Al Jazeera journalist Shireen Abu Akleh, who was shot during an Israeli military raid in the West Bank, was "likely" killed by "armed Palestinians, who were firing indiscriminately at the time". The 51-year-old was reportedly "shot in the face". Meanwhile, Al Jazeera has accused Israeli security forces of "deliberately" targeting and killing Abu Akleh.

269.title: State laws don't apply to RBI-registered NBFCs: Supreme Court
269.article_body: State moneylending laws would have no application on non-banking finance companies (NBFCs) registered with and regulated by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), the Supreme Court (SC) said on Tuesday. The court observed that the Chapter III­B of the RBI Act is a complete code in itself. Earlier,  the Kerala High Court had said the state moneylending laws were applicable.

270.title: Ex-Mr Universe Calum von Moger fighting for life after falling from 2nd storey window
270.article_body: Ex-World Fitness Federation (WFF) Mr Universe Calum von Moger is fighting for his life after falling from a second storey-window in Australia. The actor and bodybuilder underwent a major surgery after injuring his spine and is currently in induced coma. As per fellow bodybuilder and YouTuber Nick Trigilli, Calum was under the influence of drugs when the incident took place.

271.title: 'My 65-yr-old dad got 10 stitches, broken arm due to Ola e-scooter bug,' claims son
271.article_body: A man named Pallav Maheshwari claimed that his 65-year-old father was "severely injured" due to a "software bug in Ola electric scooter of going in reverse at full speed". "He banged his head on a wall with almost skull open (with 10 stitches now) and broke his left arm which would've to be operated with 2 plates inserted," Maheshwari claimed.

272.title: Don't think RR have high hopes from Boult, he is not reliable: Manjrekar
272.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Sanjay Manjrekar said he doesn't think RR will have high hopes from their pacer Trent Boult, adding that he is not reliable in the middle and death overs. "If he was such an important player, MI would have bid for him," stated Manjrekar. Boult has picked nine wickets in IPL 2022 so far at an economy rate of 8.37.

273.title: Industries to be set up on closed textile mills’ land in UP: State minister
273.article_body: Uttar Pradesh government has decided to set up industries on the land of the closed textile mills located in various districts of the state, UP Industrial Development Minister, Nand Gopal Gupta Nandi, said. The land of the closed textile mills will be allotted to entrepreneurs to set up industries or launch new ventures, Nandi added.

274.title: NIA to open office in MP to probe terror activities: MP Home Minister
274.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) will soon open its office in MP to investigate terror activities, state Home Minister Narottam Mishra said on Wednesday. "The agency is conducting...probe into...activities of terrorist organisations like Al-Soofa and Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB) in the state," he said. Earlier in March, MP police had arrested four alleged members of JMB in Bhopal.

275.title: 12-yr-old girl gang-raped in Pune, 2 men including 18-yr-old arrested
275.article_body: A 12-year-old girl was allegedly gang-raped in the Pimpri-Chinchwad area of Pune district on April 21, following which two accused have been arrested. The men, aged 18 and 21, also allegedly molested the girl a few days after raping her. The 18-year-old is a welder, while the 21-year-old man is a rickshaw-puller and they live in the girl's neighbourhood.

276.title: Marcos visits dictator father's grave after Philippines election win
276.article_body: Ferdinand Marcos Junior visited the grave of his dictator father, Ferdinand Marcos, after winning the Philippines' Presidential election on Tuesday. One of the images shared by Marcos appeared to show him wiping away tears as he stood before the grave. Ferdinand Marcos died in exile in 1989, but his remains were only interred in the Manila "heroes" cemetery in 2016.

277.title: Sorry, studio was full: Kapil to fan who wasn't allowed to give him his sketch
277.article_body: Comedian Kapil Sharma took to Twitter to retweet a sketch made by one of his fans and apologised after the fan said that he was not allowed to present the sketch to Kapil. "Thank you for beautiful sketch, and sorry for inconvenience, studio was full that's why they didn't allow, see you some other time. Lots of love," Kapil wrote.

278.title: Victory, says Mahua Moitra after SC puts sedition law on hold
278.article_body: Soon after the Supreme Court put the sedition law on hold, TMC leader Mahua Moitra on Wednesday tweeted "Victory". "Supreme Court stays Section 124A - no new cases can be filed, existing cases can apply for bail and release immediately," Moitra added. "Great day for democracy," Moitra said in another tweet.

279.title: 8,500 MW of power available, daily demand 8,300 MW: Haryana Minister
279.article_body: Haryana Power Minister Ranjit Singh Chautala on Tuesday claimed that 8,500 MW of power is available from all the resources in the state, whereas the daily demand for electricity is about 8,300 MW. Chautala added Haryana is the only state managing its power issues with ease, compared to the power crunch being faced in 16 states of Northern India.

280.title: Held for cyber crime, class-10 dropout behind 1,352 cases: Chandigarh Police
280.article_body: Chandigarh Police have arrested a 23-year-old man, Vikas, for cheating woman of ₹83,979 on April 19. Police said that the man is a class-10 dropout and has been involved in 1,352 such cases across the country. The accused used just four IMEI numbers, a 15-digit number that is unique to each device, to carry out all the crimes, police added.

281.title: 8 yrs of PM Modi-led govt led to global debate on terrorism: Jaishankar
281.article_body: Eight years of PM Narendra Modi-led government led to a global debate on terrorism, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said on Wednesday. "He has practised development-focused diplomacy, focused on border infra development to meet security challenges, he takes interest in trade and addressed all our embassies to reach $400 billion exports," Jaishankar added.

282.title: What's cerebral aneurysm, the life-threatening disease Xi Jinping may be suffering from?
282.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping is reportedly suffering from cerebral aneurysm. A cerebral aneurysm is a weak or thin spot on an artery in brain that balloons or bulges out and fills with blood, according to US' National Institutes of Health. Bleeding into the brain from bulging aneurysm can lead to headache, permanent damage to the brain or even death.

283.title: Had to do comedy just 10 days after dad's death, got standing ovation: Krushna
283.article_body: Comedian Krushna Abhishek said that he had to do a comedy show just 10 days after his father passed away because the makers could not take in another anchor. "The performance...I gave that day...Everyone gave me...standing ovation...That this guy, despite facing such a tough time, his father has passed just 10 days ago, and he made everyone laugh," he added.

284.title: 50% women aged 15-24 yrs use cloth for menstrual protection: NFHS Report
284.article_body: According to National Family Health Survey report, about 50% of Indian women aged between 15 to 24 years still use cloth for menstrual protection. Using unclean cloth increases exposure to multiple local infections as well as the risk of cervical cancer, experts warned. The survey, however, stated that overall 78% of women in this age group use a hygienic method.

285.title: Bike with dead body hits speed breaker, reveals murder of B'luru woman
285.article_body: A Bengaluru-based woman's murder was revealed after a couple's plan to dispose of her body failed. The couple's friends were going to dispose of her body when their bike hit a speed breaker in front of a DCP's office and they fell. After the accident, police took them to hospital and learned that the woman had died eight hours ago.

286.title: Delhi man forges President's letterhead to promote fake university
286.article_body: The Delhi Police's Special Cell has registered a case against a man for allegedly forging the President's letterhead to promote a fake digital university in Delhi. Amardeep Singh used the President's signature under his own to inform people that India's first digital university, Vikramshila University, was going to be inaugurated shortly. The FIR was registered on May 2.

287.title: 50-tonne concrete segment falls at Ghaziabad project site
287.article_body: A 50-tonne concrete segment fell off at the under-construction Modinagar site of the Regional Rapid Transit System project on the Delhi-Meerut Road in Ghaziabad on Tuesday evening. The concrete segment was being hoisted using a high-capacity crane. "The cable snapped during the load testing...incident took place inside the barricaded area...no damage or any injury took place," an official said.

288.title: 2 babies die at private hospital due to 'medical negligence' in Hyd
288.article_body: At least two new-born babies died at a private hospital in Hyderabad on Tuesday due to medical negligence, their family members have alleged. They claimed that the babies were kept in incubators and added that the babies had burn injuries near their chest and stomach. The family members have not lodged any complaints in this regard, an official said.

289.title: Ukraine successfully struck Russian resupply vessels in Black Sea: UK
289.article_body: Ukraine has "successfully" struck Russian air defences and resupply vessels stationed in the Black Sea with Bayraktar drones, UK Defence Ministry said. "Russia's resupply vessels have minimum protection in the western Black Sea, following the Russian Navy's retreat to Crimea after the loss of the Moskva," it added. The ministry also said that fighting is continuing on Ukraine's Zmiinyi Island.

290.title: HR tech startup Hono raises $5 million led by Aakash Chaudhry
290.article_body: Human resource tech startup Hono has raised $5 million in a funding round led by Aakash Chaudhry, Managing Director of Aakash+BYJU's. Chaudhry has made a personal investment of $4 million. The remaining amount was raised from Hemant Sultania, Amit Khanna of Amaya Ventures, and Harsh Gupta of Udayat Group. Chaudhry will also be part of the board at Hono.

291.title: 24x7 digital payments helpline 'DigiSaathi' now on WhatsApp: NPCI
291.article_body: The government's 24x7 helpline 'DigiSaathi' that provides information on digital payment products and services is now available on WhatsApp, the National Payments Commission of India (NPCI) said. Users can access the helpline by texting +91-892-891-3333 via WhatsApp. It answers queries on cards, UPI, NEFT, RTGS, Wallets, ATM, QR (UPI/Bharat), mobile and net banking, among others.

292.title: Events in Sri Lanka wake-up call for India: Mehbooba Mufti
292.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Mehbooba Mufti on Wednesday said the situation in Sri Lanka should serve as a wake-up call for India. Mufti tweeted, "Since 2014, India is being whipped into a communal frenzy." She added, "It [India] is treading the same path of hyper-nationalism and religious majoritarianism. All at cost of disrupting social cohesion and economic security."

293.title: Biker dies while overtaking truck, Cyberabad Police shares video of accident
293.article_body: The Cyberabad Traffic Police on Wednesday shared a video showing a man riding a bike being hit by a truck in Gagilapur. The video shows the man overtaking the truck from the left, after which he is run over by the truck. The traffic police said that the man died in the accident.

294.title: Assam CM mistakenly refers to Amit Shah as PM at an event, video surfaces
294.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma mistakenly referred to Amit Shah as Prime Minister and PM Narendra Modi as Home Minister while speaking at a public event. The Assam Congress has shared a video showing Sarma addressing a huge gathering. The Congress asked if a campaign has been launched to promote Union Home Minister Amit Shah as the Prime Minister.

295.title: We respect court, but there's a 'Laxman Rekha': Minister after SC's sedition law order
295.article_body: After the Supreme Court ordered to put the sedition law on hold, Law Minister Kiren Rijiju said, "We respect the court and its independence. But there's a 'Laxman Rekha' that must be respected by all organs of the state." He added that they have to ensure that they respect the provisions of the Indian Constitution as well as existing laws.

296.title: Playing Draco in 'Harry...' did me no favours with girls in school: Tom
296.article_body: Actor Tom Felton, who played Draco Malfoy in the 'Harry Potter' franchise, said that portraying the negative character "was not cool" for him during his school years. "I wasn't this special, popular kid, but I was walking around with dyed hair and played an evil wizard...It did me no favours with the girls," he added.

297.title: US House approves $40 billion further aid for Ukraine
297.article_body: The US House of Representatives passed a Bill to approve over $40 billion in further aid to Ukraine, which is fighting Russia. "This Bill will protect democracy, limit Russian aggression and strengthen our own national security, while most importantly, support Ukraine," a Democratic Representative said. Some Republican members opposed the move for sending too much of taxpayers' money abroad.

298.title: Pant shouldn't think too much, just smack the ball like Russell: Shastri
298.article_body: Ex-India coach Ravi Shastri said DC captain Rishabh Pant should just smack the ball like KKR all-rounder Andre Russell, rather than thinking too much. "Who knows, you might win more matches than people expect you to," added Shastri. "[Pant's] getting off to starts and then getting out in a manner which he wouldn't like," stated Shastri.

299.title: Jacqueline moves court for permission to travel abroad after seizure of passport
299.article_body: Jacqueline Fernandez, who is on the radar of the Enforcement Directorate for her connection with alleged conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar, has moved an application in a Delhi court seeking permission to travel abroad to attend the IIFA Awards in Abu Dhabi. She has also sought permission to travel to France and Nepal. The ED has seized Fernandez's passport.

300.title: Kiran Bedi trolled for sharing fake video of shark jumping and pulling down helicopter
300.article_body: Retired IPS officer Kiran Bedi has been trolled for sharing a fake video showing a shark jumping out of the water and pulling down a helicopter. "How can someone even remotely believe this video could be true, let alone an IPS officer," a user wrote. "Is your account hacked?" wrote another. "Laudable, even if manufactured? Sure, cheers!" another comment read.

301.title: Trump asked if China had developed a 'Hurricane Gun' to attack US: Officials
301.article_body: During his tenure as US President, Donald Trump asked his aides if China had a weapon that could shoot human-made hurricanes to attack US, according to a Rolling Stone article quoting officials. Trump began asking his aides about the supposed weapon during first year of his presidency and the issue kept resurfacing until the second year, the officials reportedly said.

302.title: Glad I never had him as a coach: Ex-Man Utd star Evra on Pep Guardiola
302.article_body: Former Manchester United defender Patrice Evra said he is "glad" he was never coached by Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola. "You have the impression that he is playing on the PlayStation," added Evra. "Guardiola doesn't want leaders. He doesn't want personality," he stated. "There is no Plan B. When they are in trouble, what do they do?" said Evra.

303.title: CCTV footage shows moment rocket-propelled grenade hits Punjab Police's Intel HQ
303.article_body: A CCTV footage of the rocket-propelled grenade attack at the Punjab Police's intelligence headquarters in Mohali has surfaced. The video shows a car passing and a flash of light as the grenade hits the Intelligence Wing headquarters. Earlier, Punjab Police arrested a man named Nishan Singh, who allegedly gave shelter to suspects in the blast case.

304.title: Germany reopens its embassy in Ukraine's Kyiv after over 2 months
304.article_body: Germany reopened its embassy in Ukraine's Kyiv after over two months since its closure due to the Russian invasion. German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock, who visited the towns of Bucha and Irpin, where civilian killings were reported, said her country will support Ukraine in probing and prosecuting war crimes. We will support Ukraine at the International Criminal Court, she added.

305.title: Man assaults ex-girlfriend, kills her new boyfriend in B'luru; held
305.article_body: A man allegedly assaulted his ex-girlfriend and beat her new boyfriend to death in Bengaluru. According to police, the 24-year-old woman broke up with the accused a year ago, later entered into a new relationship with her colleague and started living together with him. However, when the accused learned about this, he attacked them. Meanwhile, police have arrested the accused.

306.title: TN teens hurl casteist abuses at 11-yr-old, push him into live fire; booked
306.article_body: Tamil Nadu Police have booked three teenagers for allegedly hurling casteist abuses at an 11-year-old boy and pushing him into live fire in Viluppuram. When his family members enquired about the burns on his body, the class 6 student said he fell on a burning bush. After much coaxing, he revealed that upper caste students from school bullied him.

307.title: Why not let him go?: SC to UP govt on MLA Azam Khan's bail plea
307.article_body: Supreme Court has asked the UP government to file a reply to Samajwadi Party MLA Azam Khan's plea over delay in hearing his bail application in a land grabbing case. "What is this? Why not let him go. He has been in jail [for] two years. One or two cases is okay...it cannot be in 89 cases," the court said.

308.title: China warns US warship sailing through Taiwan Strait
308.article_body: Chinese military on Wednesday said it'd monitored and warned a US warship that had sailed through the Taiwan Strait. "The US frequently stages such dramas and provokes trouble, sending wrong signals to Taiwan independence forces and deliberately intensifying tensions across the Taiwan Strait," it added. The ship transited through Taiwan Strait "in accordance with international law", US Navy said.

309.title: Was 15 kg more than my usual weight during Mimi, felt unfit: Kriti Sanon
309.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon said she remembers feeling unfit towards the end of schedule of the movie 'Mimi' and added she was 15 kilos more than her usual weight. "I began working out at home with help of virtual trainers. I lost all the excess weight during the lockdown...When you feel so unfit, you understand the importance of fitness," she added.

310.title: Man arrested for putting up Khalistan flags outside Himachal Assembly
310.article_body: One of the two men accused of putting up Khalistan flags at the Himachal Pradesh Vidhan Sabha gate was arrested on Wednesday. The arrested person, Harbir Singh alias Raju (30), is a resident of Punjab's Rupnagar, police said. The accused had also scrawled graffiti on the boundary wall of the Himachal Pradesh Assembly at Tapovan near Dharamshala on May 8.

311.title: BJP's biggest weakness is its dependence on PM Modi: Prashant Kishor
311.article_body: Political strategist Prashant Kishor on Tuesday said that BJP's biggest weakness at present is the party's dependence on Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Commenting on BJP's biggest opposition threat between AAP and Congress, he added, "Congress, any day." Congress needs to learn how to be in opposition and how to behave like an Opposition party, Kishor further said.

312.title: 800 WhiteHat Jr employees resign after being asked to return to office: Report
312.article_body: More than 800 employees of kids online coding learning startup WhiteHat Jr, which was acquired by BYJU'S, have resigned in the last 60 days after they were asked to return to their offices, Inc42 reported. WhiteHat Jr's full-time employees from various teams across the company resigned. They were asked to report to their respective offices in a month's time.

313.title: Shopkeeper held for stalking 20-yr-old former employee in Ludhiana
313.article_body: Police on Tuesday arrested a shopkeeper in Ludhiana for stalking his former employee and sending her lewd messages. According to the 20-year-old woman's father, the shopkeeper used to harass her following which she quit the job. "But after she quit...he started sending her lewd messages. When his repeated calls to her went unanswered, he reached our house," her father stated.

314.title: Musk says Tesla is open to buying a mining firm in push for clean energy
314.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said that Tesla is open to buying a mining company in a push for the worldwide adoption of clean energy technologies. "It's not out of the question. We will address whatever limitations are on accelerating the world's transition to sustainable energy. It's not that we wish to buy mining companies," he added.

315.title: Man killed, his 3-yr-old son injured in celebratory firing in UP, 2 held
315.article_body: Two men were arrested in UP’s Muzaffarnagar after a 35-year-old man was killed and his three-year-old son was injured in a celebratory firing during a wedding, police said on Tuesday. The incident occurred late on Monday night. "Two wedding guests have been arrested. They were found involved in celebratory firing," Station House Officer (SHO), Vinod Kumar, said.

316.title: Split verdict by Delhi HC on criminalising marital rape, matter referred to SC
316.article_body: After hearing petitions challenging the exception to Section 375 of IPC, which exempts forced sexual intercourse by a man with his wife, from the offence of rape, the Delhi High Court's two-judge bench arrived on a split decision. Referring the matter to Supreme Court, Justice Rajiv Shakdher held the exception unconstitutional while Justice C Hari Shankar said it wasn't unconstitutional.

317.title: They can't feel what I feel, they can't live my life: Virat Kohli on critics amid poor form
317.article_body: Talking about critics questioning him over his poor form, RCB batter Virat Kohli, in an interaction with Danish Sait, said, "They can't be in my shoes. They can't feel what I feel." He added, "They can't live my life. They can't live those moments." Kohli further said that he doesn't pay attention to the "outside noise".

318.title: I feel insulted: Bengali writer returns award as Mamata Banerjee gets literary honour
318.article_body: Bengali writer Ratna Rashid Banerjee has returned the 'Annada Shankar Smarak Samman' given to her by the Paschimbanga Bangla Academy over its decision to confer a special award on West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee. "I feel insulted. The statement of the Academy praising the relentless literary pursuit of the honourable Chief Minister is a travesty of truth," Banerjee said.

319.title: 'Disgusted' with actors in India: 'Raajneeti' director Prakash Jha
319.article_body: Director Prakash Jha who helmed 'Raajneeti' starring Ranbir Kapoor and Katrina Kaif, said he is "disgusted" with actors working in India. "They don't know what acting is about," added Jha. Discussing his web series 'Aashram', Jha stated, "'Aashram' has 1.6 billion views which is probably the most viewed web series in the world. It is double the size of IPL."

320.title: Man rapes 14-yr-old girl in Delhi, buries dead infant after abortion; held
320.article_body: Police have arrested a 23-year-old man, Dharamender alias Raj, for raping and impregnating a 14-year-old girl in Delhi after befriending her. Police said that Raj told victim to not disclose pregnancy to anyone and took her to an alleged female doctor who gave her abortion pills. The victim delivered a dead infant next day. The infant was buried by accused.

321.title: Stablecoin UST, that's meant to maintain a $1 peg, crashes to 40 cents
321.article_body: TerraUSD or 'UST', a stablecoin that's meant to maintain a $1 peg, plunged over 55% on Wednesday from 24 hours earlier to around 40 cents. Its sister token fell more than 80% to $5 and other cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and Ether also plunged. A stablecoin is a digital currency pegged to a "stable" reserve asset like the US dollar.

322.title: Insecticide & plastic ingredients found inside pregnant women: Study
322.article_body: Dozens of chemicals used to make plastics and those found in insecticides were found in several pregnant women during a study that analysed 171 pregnant women in the US. Scientists looked for 89 different chemicals in participants and found 73 of them in at least one person. Moreover, 36 of these substances were found in over 50% of the participants.

323.title: Maha court sentences man to life imprisonment for raping 8-yr-old girl
323.article_body: A court in Maharashtra sentenced a man to life imprisonment for raping an eight-year-old girl. The incident occurred in 2017 when the accused allegedly took the girl to an isolated place and raped her. The girl's parents later found her bleeding in the custody of the accused. The incident took place in Sativali area of Palghar.

324.title: Allah made him for me, his caste never mattered: Hyd murder victim's wife
324.article_body: Syed Ashrin Sultana, wife of Dalit man Billipuram Nagaraju, who was killed by Sultana's brother in Hyderabad said his caste never mattered to her. "I never even used to look at him as Hindu. I only thought he was made for me...that Allah made him for me," she added. Sultana said she never thought her brother would kill her husband.

325.title: Aayush Sharma pens note after death of his grandfather and ex-minister Pandit Sukh Ram
325.article_body: Actor Aayush Sharma penned a note after the death of his grandfather and former Union minister Pandit Sukh Ram. "Even though you're gone, I know you'll always be with me, guiding me, looking over me and blessing me like you always do. Rest in peace dadaji, you will be dearly missed," the actor wrote.

326.title: BP Care Juice reduced high BP of 91% of users in 3 months: Kapiva
326.article_body: Kapiva Academy of Ayurveda claims 91% of its consumers observed a drop in high blood pressure with BP Care Juice, while 69% reduced their allopathy medicine dosage. The juice contains Arjuna, Shankhpushpi, Guggul, and 7+ herbs, which lowers blood pressure, improves blood circulation, reduces bad cholesterol, strengthens heart muscles, and reduces the risk of heart disease, Kapiva added.

327.title: Maha govt to speed up vaccination drive to combat possible 4th wave
327.article_body: Amid rising COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra, the state government has decided to speed up the vaccination process to combat the fourth wave that may arrive by June or July. "There are people who refuse to take...vaccine...Due to them, the vaccination number...is low," Health Minister Rajesh Tope said. If cases rise, the mask mandate will also be brought back, he added.

328.title: 6-month-old girl found gagged in bushes in Punjab’s Zirakpur
328.article_body: A six-month-old baby girl was found in roadside bushes in Punjab's Zirakpur on Tuesday. The baby, who was gagged and covered with a cloth, was noticed by two motorcycle-borne youths, police said. "The infant was rushed to a hospital in Dhakoli and was found stable," Sub-Inspector Rajinder Singh, Zirakpur police station, said.

329.title: 3 people injured in separate leopard attacks in Pune district
329.article_body: Three people were injured in three separate incidents of leopard attacks in Khed and Ambegaon talukas of Pune district on Tuesday night and Wednesday early morning. Of those injured, two are women and one of them is critical. The two places of attack are located around one-and-half-kilometre away from each other. Forest rangers have stepped up vigil in these areas.

330.title: Felt like I've seen everything now: Kohli on smiling after 2nd golden duck in IPL 2022
330.article_body: Virat Kohli, in a video shared by RCB, said he felt helpless after he recorded his second golden duck in IPL 2022. "It hasn't happened to me ever in my career...That's why I smiled because I felt like I've seen everything now. It has been so long that I have seen everything this game has to show me," Kohli added.

331.title: Earthquake of magnitude 4.6 strikes Pithoragarh in Uttarakhand
331.article_body: An earthquake of magnitude 4.6 on the Richter scale hit Uttarakhand's Pithoragarh on Wednesday morning. According to the National Center for Seismology (NCS), the quake struck at around 10 am, at a depth of five kilometres. The tremors were felt about 20 km northeast of Pithoragarh, NCS tweeted. According to reports, there was no loss of life or property.

332.title: Passenger with no flying experience lands plane in US after pilot falls unconscious
332.article_body: A passenger with no flying experience safely landed a 14-seater Cessna 208 Caravan plane at a Florida airport after the pilot fell unconscious. The passenger contacted air traffic controllers and was heard saying, "I've got a serious situation here...My pilot has gone incoherent. I've no idea how to fly the airplane." The controllers located the plane and guided the passenger.

333.title: 43,489 students miss Class 10 board exams in Odisha, govt orders probe
333.article_body: As many as 43,489 students missed their Class 10 board exams in Odisha that ended on May 7. Odisha government has ordered a probe after it was found out that 5.71 lakh students had filled up forms for exams and only 5.3 lakh appeared. Officials have been directed to conduct a school-wise analysis and submit a report within 10 days.

334.title: ASI expresses concern after J&K LG Manoj Sinha prays at protected Sun Temple: Report
334.article_body: The Archaeological Survey of India has "expressed concern to the administration" after Jammu & Kashmir Lieutenant-Governor Manoj Sinha participated in prayers at the ruins of protected eighth-century Martand Sun Temple, The Indian Express reported. The agency reportedly said no permission was sought to conduct the ceremony and asked the administration to ensure such violations are not repeated.

335.title: Teen couple found hanging from tree in Rajasthan village
335.article_body: A 19-year-old man and an 18-year-old woman, reported to be lovers, allegedly hanged themselves to death from a tree in a village in Rajasthan's Jhalawar district. They also consumed poison, a bottle of which was found nearby, according to police. No suicide note was found at the site, added police. The couple had gone missing on Monday night.

336.title: Al Jazeera female journalist shot in the face by Israeli forces: Qatar minister
336.article_body: Al Jazeera journalist Shireen Abu Akleh was shot dead by Israeli troops on Wednesday as she covered a raid on Jenin refugee camp in the occupied West Bank, the network said. Qatar's Assistant Foreign Minister Lolwah Al-Khater said that Akleh was shot "in the face". Al Jazeera added that the 51-year-old was shot "deliberately" by Israeli troops.

337.title: Arjun's very controversial but doesn't get bad press like I do: Kangana
337.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut said actor Arjun Rampal is "very controversial" but doesn't get bad press like she does. "He says what he says, does what he does," added Kangana. "A guy can get away with anything," stated Kangana. Arjun and Kangana will star together in the upcoming film 'Dhaakad' which is a spy thriller scheduled to release on May 20.

338.title: Uttarakhand govt increases daily cap on pilgrims to Char Dham
338.article_body: The Uttarakhand government has decided to increase the daily number of pilgrims by 1,000 each to Yamunotri, Gangotri, Kedarnath and Badrinath, CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said. With this, 13,000 devotees can have 'darshan' at the Kedarnath Dham while 16,000 pilgrims can visit Badrinath in a day. As many as 5,000 and 8,000 devotees can visit Yamunotri and Gangotri respectively.

339.title: Google to pay over 300 news publishers in EU, more to follow
339.article_body: Google has agreed to pay over 300 publishers across the EU for their news and will roll out a tool for others to sign up too. However, Google has not revealed how much publishers will be paid. The EU had earlier adopted the copyright rules that require Google and other online platforms to pay news publishers for using their work.

340.title: Several offices at Vishveshwarya Bhawan in Patna gutted in fire; no casualties
340.article_body: Several offices were destroyed after a major fire broke out at the Vishveshwarya Bhawan (also called the technical secretariat) on the Jawahar Lal Nehru Marg in Bihar's Patna around 7:30 am on Wednesday. The preliminary cause of the fire is said to be a short circuit. Some labourers trapped inside the building were rescued timely. No casualty was reported.

341.title: Apologise to North Indians or go back: BJP MP ahead of MNS chief's Ayodhya visit
341.article_body: Ahead of MNS chief Raj Thackeray’s visit to Ayodhya on June 5, BJP MP Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh has demanded a public apology from him for calling North Indians "criminals" in the past. "Raj Thackeray, who called North Indians criminals, should either apologise or go back," read the posters circulated by the BJP MP.

342.title: Rahul seeks permanent relief from court appearance in defamation case
342.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has sought permanent exemption from appearing before a court in Maharashtra's Bhiwandi in a defamation case. He has been accused of defaming the RSS by holding it responsible for the killing of Mahatma Gandhi. In his application, Gandhi said being an MP, he has to visit his constituency and travel a lot for party work.

343.title: Man molests 18-year-old girl at housing society swimming pool in Pune
343.article_body: An 18-year-old girl was allegedly molested by a 47-year-old man at a housing society swimming pool in Pune. The victim said that the accused had also passed lewd remarks and told her, "If you are dressed like this, you are bound to get attraction." The victim's mother has lodged a complaint with the Kondhwa Police against the accused.

344.title: Disabled UPI payments because of informal pressure from RBI: Coinbase CEO
344.article_body: Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong has said that the cryptocurrency exchange suspended its UPI payment method due to informal pressure from Reserve Bank of India (RBI). "India's Supreme Court has ruled that they can't ban crypto, but there are elements in the government there, including RBI, who don't seem to be as positive on it," he further said.

345.title: Elon Musk's tweets on taking Tesla private were reckless: US judge
345.article_body: A US judge said in an April judgement that Tesla CEO Elon Musk's 2018 tweets on taking Tesla private were inaccurate and reckless, adding "there was nothing concrete" about financing from Saudi Arabia's PIF. "Rather, discussions between Tesla and the PIF were clearly at the preliminary stage," the judge added. Musk has insisted that tweets were entirely truthful.

346.title: Man assaults 26-year-old DU student over speaking in English
346.article_body: A 26-year-old Delhi University student was allegedly assaulted by a man after a fight over speaking in English. The incident occurred at a grocery store in Malviya Nagar. According to the FIR, the men got into an argument and the victim, identified as Anshuman Thapa, allegedly pushed the accused, who then ordered his pitbull to attack Thapa.

347.title: Pits for bodies dug before couple came from US: Report on Chennai double murder
347.article_body: The accused who killed the Chennai couple who had returned from the United States had already dug pits for their bodies before they arrived in India, reports said, adding, police found pair of gloves and burnt cell phone on ground where the two were buried. "When we saw this, we confirmed that definitely a murder has been committed," Police said.

348.title: Some current Hindi films very boring, painful: 'LOC...' actor Himanshu
348.article_body: Actor-turned-director Himanshu Malik who starred in the war film 'LOC: Kargil' said he finds some of the current Bollywood films "very boring" and "painful". "The world is one big marketplace. That puts a lot of pressure on traditional filmmakers," added Himanshu. "Once you go behind the camera...you can enjoy eating everything without worrying about gaining weight," stated Himanshu.

349.title: Stop partisan politics, treat everyone equally: WB Guv urges state govt
349.article_body: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar on Tuesday met victims of post-poll violence and asked the state government to stop "partisan politics". While comparing the victims of Birbhum's Bogtui village, where eight people were burnt alive, Dhankhar said that if they can get compensation, then those affected by post-poll violence should receive it too. "Everybody should be treated equally," he added.

350.title: Man who set woman on fire 2 days before her wedding in Gurugram held
350.article_body: A 22-year-old man, who allegedly set a 24-year-old woman on fire two days before her wedding in Gurugram, has been arrested, police said. "The man said he couldn't see her getting married to someone else so he tried to kill her," the police added. The man poured petrol on her when she refused to call off the wedding, police stated.
