351.title: India denies sending troops to Sri Lanka, says 'fully supportive of its democracy'
351.article_body: The Indian High Commission on Wednesday categorically denied "speculative" reports about India sending troops to Sri Lanka. It said, "These reports and such views are not in keeping with the position of the Government of India." It added, "The Spokesperson of Ministry of External Affairs clearly stated that India is fully supportive of Sri Lanka's democracy, stability and economic recovery."

352.title: 13 boys aged between 13 and 15 harass 2 female tourists in Egypt; arrested
352.article_body: Thirteen boys aged between 13 and 15 have been arrested after being accused of harassing two female tourists at Egypt's Giza Pyramids. In a video of the incident, one of the female tourists can be seen attempting to push one of the boys away from her. The boys said they were trying to take photos with the women.

353.title: 8 charged for selling Pakistani MBBS seats in J&K, using money for terrorism
353.article_body: A Srinagar court has charged eight people, including a Hurriyat leader, for selling Pakistani MBBS seats in Jammu and Kashmir. The accused, in association with educational consultancies, were allegedly arranging admissions of J&K residents in MBBS and other courses in Pakistani colleges and universities. The money thus earned from the parents of the students was used in supporting terrorism.

354.title: MP policeman kills 6-yr-old for demanding money, dumps body in Gwalior
354.article_body: A police head constable allegedly killed a six-year-old boy in Madhya Pradesh's Datia district for demanding money from him and dumped his body in Gwalior, an official said. The accused, who was posted in Gwalior, was arrested, police said. The policeman claimed he was suffering from depression and got irritated when the boy kept asking for money, police added.

355.title: Wife of health inspector run over by train in Ambala
355.article_body: The wife of a health inspector in Ambala was run over by a train near Jandli Fatak on Tuesday. She left home at 9 am and was hit by the train an hour later. Police informed her family using a phone number they found in her wallet. Her husband said she had not been keeping well lately and was stressed.

356.title: Sri Lanka Prez warns of racial & religious tensions amid riots
356.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa urged people to reject attempts to foment "racial and religious disharmony" as violent clashes broke out in many parts of the country over the government's handling of the economic crisis. "This is the time for all Sri Lankans to join hands as one," Rajapaksa added. At least eight people have been killed in the clashes.

357.title: Don't say comedy is in danger due to me: Munawar on Sunil Pal's vulgarity remark
357.article_body: After comedian Sunil Pal asked comedian Munawar Faruqui to save comedy from vulgarity, the latter said he respects comedy as much as Sunil does. "Please don't say that comedy is in danger because of me...We all can save comedy together. Your way is different...You said I don't have 'aukaat' (worth), I'll make my worth," he added.

358.title: Thane man held for spiking drinks of female friends, sexually assaulting them
358.article_body: Thane police arrested a 33-year-old man for allegedly spiking the drinks of women and sexually assaulting them. He was arrested following a complaint by a 23-year-old woman. The accused usually befriended women and asked them out on pretext of celebrating their birthday or any similar occasion, police said. He would then spike their drinks and assault them sexually, police added.

359.title: Supreme Court puts sedition law on hold
359.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday put the sedition law on hold and urged Centre and states to refrain from registering any FIRs invoking Section 124A of IPC. The court allowed the Centre to re-examine and reconsider the provisions of Section 124A and said that no case will be registered under the section till the exercise of re-examination is complete.

360.title: Kuldeep Yadav is too slow in the air, always a gamble for DC: Manjrekar
360.article_body: Former India batter Sanjay Manjrekar said DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav is a bit "too slow" in the air which always makes him a gamble for DC. "If Kuldeep works on his fitness and flight and overcomes his natural weakness, he will be more effective," added Manjrekar. Kuldeep has picked 18 wickets in 11 IPL 2022 matches so far.

361.title: SP-rank officer may be asked to monitor registration of sedition FIRs: Centre to SC
361.article_body: The Centre has told the Supreme Court that a Superintendent of Police-rank officer can be made responsible for monitoring registration of FIRs for the offence of sedition. The government added that staying provisions of sedition may not be the "correct approach". With regard to pending cases, the Centre suggested that hearing on bail pleas in such matters may be expedited.

362.title: I saw 'RRR', it blew my brains; loved 'KGF 1' and 'Pushpa': Ranveer
362.article_body: Speaking about films like 'RRR', 'Pushpa: The Rise' and 'KGF: Chapter 1', actor Ranveer Singh said, "'RRR' blew my brains. I loved 'Pushpa: The Rise' and 'KGF: Chapter 1'. I am dying to see 'KGF: Chapter 2'." "I am a huge fan of Allu Arjun, Yash," added Ranveer. "[The] technical aspects of these films are impressive," stated Ranveer.

363.title: What is tomato flu, reported in over 80 children in Kerala?
363.article_body: Tomato flu has been detected in over 80 children aged below five in Kerala. Tomato flu is an unidentified fever that causes rashes and blisters which are generally red in colour. Symptoms of the disease include skin irritation, body aches and high fever. Infected children can also have joint swellings, tiredness, cramps in the stomach, nausea, vomiting and diarrhoea.

364.title: Pakistani rupee falls to all-time low against US dollar
364.article_body: The Pakistani rupee fell to an all-time low against US dollar on Tuesday in the interbank market. Its value surged by 82 paisa in early trade and is currently trading at PKR 188.35 in the interbank market. Meanwhile, State Bank of Pakistan's foreign exchange reserves fell by $328 million to $10.558 billion during the week that ended on April 23.

365.title: Gold coloured chariot washes ashore in Andhra amid cyclone Asani; video goes viral
365.article_body: A video showing a gold coloured chariot washing ashore in Andhra Pradesh's Srikakulam district amid cyclone Asani has gone viral on social media. The chariot is suspected to have washed away from a faraway Southeast Asian country due to the impact of the cyclone, local residents said. People from neighbouring areas rushed to Srikakulam to see it.

366.title: Urdu teacher jailed for life for raping 6-yr-old girl in Rajasthan
366.article_body: An Urdu teacher has been sentenced to life imprisonment for raping a six-year-old girl at a madrassa in Rajasthan's Kota. The court also imposed a fine of ₹1 lakh on the 43-year-old convict, Abdul Rahim. According to the prosecutor, the man raped the victim when she was alone with him after other students left the class.

367.title: Putin likely to impose martial law in Russia to support war effort: US
367.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin will "likely" impose martial law in Russia to support the war in Ukraine, Director of US National Intelligence, Avril Haines, said. Putin may also order more industrial production to make up for lost resources in the war or order "potentially escalatory military actions to free up...resources needed to achieve his objectives" in Ukraine, Haines added.

368.title: 26-year-old DU student attacked by dog over speaking in English
368.article_body: A 26-year-old Delhi University student was allegedly assaulted by a man and attacked by his dog over speaking in English. The incident occurred at a grocery store in Malviya Nagar. According to the FIR, the men got into an argument and the victim, identified as Anshuman Thapa, allegedly pushed the accused, who then ordered his pitbull to attack Thapa.

369.title: Nehru couldn’t lie in court: Mahua on govt’s remark on sedition law
369.article_body: TMC leader Mahua Moitra reacted to Solicitor General Tushar Mehta’s statement made on Tuesday in the Supreme Court regarding the sedition law. "What Pandit Nehru couldn't do, the current government is doing, says SG Tushar Mehta. You are right, sir. Nehru couldn't lie in court, spy on countrymen, arrest innocents, lock-up dissenters with no due process," Moitra tweeted.

370.title: Deplatforming is a big deal: IT minister Chandrasekhar to Musk on Trump's Twitter ban
370.article_body: Union Minister of State for Electronics and Information Technology Rajeev Chandrasekhar on Wednesday tagged Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Twitter and wrote, "Deplatforming is a big deal" on a news article about former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey backing Musk's plan to reinstate former US President Donald Trump's Twitter account. Chandrasekhar also wrote, "It's a violation of fundamental rights of users."

371.title: J&K separatist leader Yasin Malik pleads guilty in 2017 terror case
371.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir separatist leader Mohammad Yasin Malik has pleaded guilty to all charges, including those under the Unlawful Activities Prevention Act (UAPA), before a Delhi court in a case related to alleged terrorism and secessionist activities that disturbed the Valley in 2017. The court will hear the matter on May 19 and decide the quantum of sentence for Malik.

372.title: Veteran Congress leader Pandit Sukh Ram passes away at 95
372.article_body: Veteran Congress leader Pandit Sukh Ram passed away aged 95 in Delhi on Wednesday morning. He had suffered a brain stroke last week. After initial treatment at Netaji Subhash Chander Bose Zonal Hospital in Mandi, he was airlifted to Delhi and admitted to AIIMS on Saturday. He served as the Union Minister of Communications and Information Technology from 1993-96.

373.title: Kerala fire officer arrested in RSS worker's murder case
373.article_body: An officer of Kerala's fire department was arrested on Tuesday in connection with the murder of an RSS worker, SK Srinivasan, in Palakkad last month. According to police, the 31-year-old accused, identified as Jishad, has close links with the Popular Front of India (PFI) and is suspected to have helped the group that killed Srinivasan.

374.title: SC refuses to stay K'taka HC order of trial against man for raping wife
374.article_body: Supreme Court on Tuesday refused to stay a Karnataka High Court order that allowed the trial of a man in a marital rape case following a complaint against him by his wife. The trial had been stayed for over five years and the woman had been waiting indefinitely for the trial to commence, the wife's advocate said.

375.title: I agree with Musk on bans, Trump's ban was a business decision: Dorsey
375.article_body: Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey has said that he agrees with Tesla CEO Elon Musk that there shouldn't be permanent bans on individual Twitter users. This comes after Musk said he will reverse former US President Donald Trump's permanent Twitter ban. Dorsey said Trump's ban was a "business decision" and that "it shouldn't have been".

376.title: Encroachment shouldn’t be seen through lens of religion: Delhi BJP chief
376.article_body: Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta said encroachment and illegal construction should not be viewed through the lens of religion. "When encroachment doesn't see religion, why should action against illegal constructions be viewed with that lens?" Gupta added. "Those who see it as an issue of specific communities being targeted are only doing so for their vote bank politics," Gupta stated.

377.title: MSRTC's first electric bus Shivai to run from Pune to Ahmednagar on June 1
377.article_body: Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC)'s first e-bus called 'Shivai' will be running from Pune to Ahmednagar from June 1. Reports said that the electric busses will be launched in a phased manner. "We have not yet got the official circular...about June 1 program, but...it is announced from head office, we have already started preparations," MSRTC Pune divisional controller said.

378.title: Felt like life's purpose was fulfilled: Akshay on being offered 'Prithviraj'
378.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar said that he felt proud when Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi offered him the film 'Prithviraj'. "I felt like my life's purpose has been fulfilled...I realised he [Prithviraj] was such a great warrior. In school...there used to be just one paragraph about him...I am extremely proud to work on the film," Akshay added.

379.title: New Zealand to fully reopen international borders from July-end
379.article_body: New Zealand PM Jacinda Ardern said the country will fully reopen its international borders from July 31 after a pandemic lockout of over two years. Reopening the borders would help relieve urgent skills shortages, revive tourism, and put immigration on a more secure footing, she added. "We're building on our proven plan to secure New Zealand's economic future," Ardern said.

380.title: Belarus to deploy special forces near border with Ukraine
380.article_body: The Belarusian armed forces said it will deploy special operations troops to three areas near its border with Ukraine. "The US and its allies continue to build up their military presence on the state borders of…Belarus," Chief of General Staff Viktor Gulevich said. Belarus is also deploying air defence, artillery and missile units for drills in the west, he added.

381.title: Delhi govt to develop 2 water bodies in Burari as 'safe open spaces'
381.article_body: Delhi Water Minister Satyendar Jain on Tuesday said two lakes in Satya Vihar and Lakshmi Vihar Extension colony in Burari will be developed as 'safe open spaces'. The minister was inspecting the development work of the two lakes which were recently revived using natural and cost-effective methods. Notably, the government is reviving 23 lakes under the 'City of Lakes' project.

382.title: Police arrest man who gave shelter to suspects in Mohali blast case
382.article_body: Police have arrested a man, Nishan Singh, who allegedly gave logistics support to suspects in the Rocket-Propelled Grenade blast that took place at Punjab Police Intelligence headquarters in Mohali on Monday. Police said Singh provided shelter to two accused in Amritsar for three days before the blast. Reports said that Singh was arrested with help of inputs provided by NIA.

383.title: Mysterious fish with bulging yellow eyes caught in Russia, pic surfaces
383.article_body: A mysterious fish with bulging yellow eyes was pulled from 1,100 metres deep in Russia. Deep-sea fisherman Roman Fedortsov shared the picture of the sea creature on Instagram. "Are these actual rare species we don’t talk about or rare abnormalities due to pollution?" a user commented. "We still don’t know what is in our oceans," wrote another.

384.title: LSG mentor Gambhir's dressing room speech after loss to GT goes viral, says 'We gave up'
384.article_body: LSG mentor Gautam Gambhir's dressing room speech following their defeat against GT went viral. In the video shared by LSG, Gambhir said, "There's nothing wrong in losing. It's absolutely fine. There's a lot wrong in giving up." He added, "Today...I thought that we gave up. We were weak. Honestly, there's no place for being weak in a tournament like IPL."

385.title: Karnataka govt bans use of loudspeakers from 10 pm to 6 am
385.article_body: Amid the Azan row, the Karnataka government issued new guidelines on Tuesday and banned the use of loudspeakers from 10 pm to 6 am in the state except in closed premises like auditoriums, conference rooms, community halls and banquet halls. Those who wish to use loudspeakers must obtain written permission from the authorities within 15 days, it added.

386.title: Clear ₹122 billion dues or we'll be forced to shut down power plants: China firms to Pak
386.article_body: More than two dozen Chinese firms operating in Pakistan on Monday said that they would be forced to shut down their power plants this month if the country does not clear the ₹122 billion dues, the Dawn reported. They said the authorities were pressuring them to maximise generation to meet peak summer needs.

387.title: Starlink resisted Russian hacks, but they're ramping up efforts: Musk
387.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk in response to a report on Russia attacking satellite internet in Ukraine said, "Starlink has resisted Russian cyberwar jamming and hacking attempts so far, but they're ramping up their efforts." Western nations' officials said Russia took tens of thousands of modems offline when the war started. Viasat's KA-SAT network had faced the attack in late February.

388.title: Musk jokingly agrees to hand over Twitter's control to YouTuber MrBeast if he dies
388.article_body: Elon Musk jokingly agreed to hand over control of Twitter to 24-year-old YouTuber MrBeast if he dies. Musk had tweeted, "If I die under mysterious circumstances, it's been nice knowing ya," after Roscosmos chief Dmitry Olegovich Rogozin accused the Tesla CEO of supplying "fascist forces in Ukraine". "Elon, you'll be held accountable like an adult," Rogozin said.

389.title: Woman beaten to death in Gujarat for spreading rumours; 4 booked
389.article_body: Police booked four persons for allegedly beating up a 60-year-old woman to death in Gujarat's Borsad. Her son alleged one of the accused called him while he was at work and said he had assaulted his mother as she was spreading rumours about him and his wife. When her son reached home, they also assaulted him with sticks and rods.

390.title: COVID compounded challenge of fighting global warming: Union Minister
390.article_body: The COVID-19 pandemic has "compounded the challenge" of fighting global warming as economic pressures have delayed the progress of climate action around the world, Union Minister Bhupender Yadav said on Tuesday. Yadav added that India has made significant progress in its commitment to restore 26 million hectares of degraded land by 2030.

391.title: India reports 2,897 COVID-19 cases, 54 deaths in 24 hours
391.article_body: India has reported 2,897 COVID-19 cases, 2,986 recoveries and 54 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,288 COVID-19 cases and 10 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 19,494, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,157.

392.title: MP minister Inder Singh Parmar's 22-yr-old daughter-in-law found hanging
392.article_body: Madhya Pradesh School Education Minister Inder Singh Parmar's 22-year-old daughter-in-law, Savita Parmar, was found hanging at their residence in Shajapur on Tuesday, ANI reported. Her body was sent for a post-mortem on Wednesday morning. The cause of the incident is said to be a "family problem" although police are yet to confirm the same, as per a report.

393.title: Ugandan woman smuggles drugs in intestine, remanded in Chennai
393.article_body: A Ugandan woman, who was found smuggling drugs in the form of capsules in her stomach, was sent to 14-day judicial custody on Tuesday. The 33-year-old accused was arrested at Chennai International Airport on May 6 after officials scanned her and found several capsules in her intestine. Forty capsules containing drugs were removed from her stomach at government hospital.

394.title: 89% of children between 6-23 months do not get 'minimum acceptable diet': NFHS
394.article_body: According to the National Family Health Survey (NFHS-5), 89% of children between the ages of 6-23 months do not get a "minimum acceptable diet". Among all states and UTs, the proportion of children aged 6-23 months who received adequate diet was highest in Meghalaya at 28.5%, while it was the lowest at 5.9% each in UP and Gujarat.

395.title: Shubman Gill reacts to getting trolled for 'slow knock', shares tortoise and hare emoji
395.article_body: GT's Shubman Gill took to Twitter to react to a news article about him getting trolled for his "slow knock" in his team's victory against LSG. He posted an emoji of a tortoise and a hare, seemingly referring to the fable, where the tortoise beats the hare in a race. Gill was named Player of the Match for scoring 63*(49).

396.title: China's zero-COVID policy not sustainable: WHO chief
396.article_body: WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus on Tuesday said that China's zero-tolerance COVID-19 policy is not sustainable considering the behaviour of the virus. WHO emergencies director Mike Ryan said the impact of a "zero-COVID" policy on human rights also needs to be taken into consideration alongside the effect on a country's economy from any COVID policy.

397.title: 4 Russian Governors resign amid worsening economy
397.article_body: Four Russian Governors resigned amid a declining economic trend owing to the sanctions imposed by the West over the Ukraine war. The heads of Tomsk, Saratov, Kirov and Mari El regions resigned, while the Governor of Ryazan region said he would not seek another term. "Kremlin was removing weak Governors amid a worsening economic outlook," said a Moscow-based think tank.

398.title: ABVP protests against Dalit prof in UP over remark on Kashi temple
398.article_body: ABVP staged a protest against Lucknow University's Associate Professor Ravi Kant, a Dalit, over "objectionable" comments on Varanasi's Kashi Vishwanath temple. The student body campus chief said that Kant expressed regret over his remark but later posted on social media that ABVP wanted to lynch him. Meanwhile, Kant said the comments were not his personal opinion but a book reference.

399.title: I would steal a lot of things: Azma Fallah on 'Lock Upp'
399.article_body: Azma Fallah who was recently seen in the first season of reality show 'Lock Upp' said she would "steal" a lot of things while participating in the show, adding she would hide things someone became obsessed with. "I did not have the strength to fight back but I could attack them through these actions," stated Azma.

400.title: Naseeruddin said 'You play the fool and the fool's the wisest': Ranveer
400.article_body: Sharing an interaction with actor Naseeruddin Shah, Ranveer Singh said, "Naseer sir told me, 'You choose to play the fool and the fool is actually the wisest one'. I am happy to be the court jester." "My wife [Deepika Padukone] keeps telling me that you are so intelligent but we don't often get to see that side," added Ranveer.

401.title: Will stay at Tesla as long as I can be useful: Elon Musk
401.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on being asked about how long he expects to stay at Tesla, said, "As long as I can be useful." Musk, who is in talks to buy Twitter, is expected to become the platform's temporary CEO. Earlier in July 2021, Musk had said he has tried "very hard not to be the CEO of Tesla".

402.title: AAP protests against 'poor' construction work at Vajpayee Stadium in B'luru
402.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) held a protest in Bengaluru on Tuesday against "poor" construction work at Atal Bihari Vajpayee Stadium. "The gallery roof [at the stadium] has collapsed barely two months after getting inaugurated by CM Basavaraj Bommai. This is an example of...40% commission corruption of...BJP government and local MLA Satish Reddy," Bengaluru AAP President Mohan Dasari said.
